cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly turning northwest Friday night and north on Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then inland up the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City / central-southeastern Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle (Hurricane) and Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) possible Friday into Saturday with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if Barry strengthens just before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft possible in the lower Mississippi River and adjacent lakes near the port, with 3–6 ft along open coast south of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches with locally 25 inches expected over southeast Louisiana, including the port area, producing life-threatening flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes Friday–Friday night; existing high Mississippi River levels may exacerbate flooding and hamper port operations.
